frame.name: FR_Attempt_suasion
frame.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> expresses through language their wish for the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change their stance about some topic. This might mean to believe that a certain <fen>True_content</fen> is true, or that some <fen>Legitimate_content</fen> is legitimate, or that they should perform some <fen>Action</fen>. There is no implication that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> ends up believing in the truth of the <fen>True_content</fen>, legitimacy of the <fen>Legitimate_content</fen>, nor forming an intention to act, let alone act. </def-root>

FE.name: True_content
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> tries for the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe that the <fen>True_content</fen> is true.</def-root>

FE.name: Legitimate_content
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> tries for the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe that the <fen>Legitimate_content</fen> is legitimate.</def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Persuader</fen> tries for the <fen>Addressee</fen> to intend to perform the <fen>Action</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person that the <fen>Persuader</fen> seeks to influence to act or hold an opinion or judgment.</def-root>

FE.name: Persuader
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who intends through the use of language or otherwise to get another person to act or form an opinion on the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>'s veracity or legitimacy.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>. </def-root>
